comments.commentBody: Robin will always be my favorite player, so I'm thrilled about the news. I guess I'll have to start paying attention to the White Sox!
Can't faul Girardi for the pitching tonight, wth only 3 runs allowed after 7. I looks like they'll have another shot at Valverde tonight!
How about ending the welfare society that has been created in this country and costs a fortune; and also instituting a flat tax?

Obama is a dolt ... We have to stop this government greed.
How much more tax do these guys waste??? All Obama is trying to do is divide one group of people from the next. If he wants millionaires and billionaires "to pay their fair share" he would propose a flat tax and eliminate all deductions. This way everyone pays the same rate, thus fair share... But nooooooo he wants some people to pay more than their fair share.... He is talking out of both sides of his mouth. Below is some of the taxes this greedy government takes,,,

1. Ad Valorem Tax
2. Building Permit Tax
3. Commercial Driver’s License Tax
4. Cigarette Tax
5. Corporate Income Tax
6. Dog License Tax
7. Excise Taxes
8. Federal Income Tax

10. Fishing License Tax
11. Food License Tax
12. Fuel Permit Tax
13. Gasoline Tax (42 cents per gallon)
14. Gross Receipts Tax
15. Hotel/Motel Tax

16. Hunting License Tax

19. Liquor Tax
20. Luxury Taxes

26. Rental Car Tax

39. Telephone Recurring and Non-recurring Charges Tax
40. Telephone State and Local Tax
41. Telephone Usage Charge Tax
42. Utility Taxes
43. Vehicle License Registration Tax
44. Vehicle Sales Tax

46. Well Permit Tax
47. Workers Compensation Tax

To commenter #7, here's a simple explanation why this American is "against higher taxes for the wealthy." Because the definition of "wealthy" is utterly subjective, and "higher" implies an infinite amount. If you want to stop hyperventilating for a moment and define your terms, we can have a discussion.
Pure posturing and avoidance of any real solution to our real problem. We are Greece to the nth power.

I am sorry to say that Mr. Obama is appearing less and less relevant.  He seems a step behind, always reactive and never proactive.  "Would be willing to accept" is just not Presidential enough for a near-Depression.  Tone deaf is more like it.  If you run for the office, you must wish to lead and sadly, Mr. Obama doesn't seem to be willing to take the risks required for true leadership.  He is starting to make 43 look good, by comparison.

Let's keep adding more tax to anyone who is successful so no one wants to work! In case anyone knows math (apparently Obama doesn't), those in the top 1%, 5%, and 10% are already paying a significant higher percentage of their income to the Feds. But Obama keeps saying they should pay more and "pay their fair share". Hey, my current rate including state and payroll is over 60% !!!!!! Is anyone in the Whitehouse able to pass 5th grade math??

The majority of Americans support raising taxes on the wealthy. Clinton did it and created 23 Million jobs. They've had their tax breaks and were supposed to create jobs.  You would think that after ten years, the right would figure that the Bush tax cuts have failed.  Not to mention the trillions they added to the deficit.  They had their chance.  They reaped all the benefits.  It's time to raise their taxes and pay their fair share.

Tax break for new hires? Check.
Tax break for hiring a Veteran? Check.
Tax break for giving a pay raise? Check.
Safer cities b/c of more police and firemen? Check.
More teachers to teach our young? Check.
Safer roads and bridges? Check.
Create 2,000,000 jobs? Check.
Tax millionaires 5% more? Why not? If the rich are truly the job creators and they invest in people and create jobs then the market grows and there is an increased demand for their product. They will make more money and it far out weighs the 5% "loss" they experienced in the tax. They will make more money, demand will go up and unemployment rate down. So.... whats the problem?

So, now the man with no history has chosen to be Robin Hood?  If he had a mask and gun(bow and arrow to be historically correct) , we could arrest him. I am not close to a millionaire, but everything I have was earned through and because of wealthy people with the drive to become wealthier.

Obama open to a tax increase? Imagine that.

It appears that the problem is that the US Government has just not given enough money away. I gather the logic goes something like this: If only the Government would give more money away, things would be better. If only the Government would take more money from one person, and give it to another, there would be more jobs.

And the New York Times supports this idiocy?

Well YES, we have to fund massive illegal immigration and anchor baby social services and later incarceration when they become gangmembers somehow!

I mean forbid that we fix the trade so people can get back to work and paying taxes again and end illegal immigration. That's just too damn much sense apparently.

Fair Free Trade – The key to sustainable recovery is the return of manufacturing (maker) jobs to the USA. US American Jobs will not return to the USA until our Local Governments adopt a policy of County Wide Fair Free Trade Zones. Where all products and/or services offered for sale/use in “The Zone” (be it county, state, or nation) must be produced and/or provided in accordance with all USA; quality, safety, health, environment and wage standards, and no one is even talking about this option. Go to: www.manifestry.info > Fair Free Trade
The Boston teacher he cites in his speech is employed.  Maybe James Carville was correct that he needs to fire some people in his Administration.  They make him look incompetent.
I am glad he's gone.  I felt that his music catered to his fan base only and did not represent a good majority of NFL fans.  I like the update to the 80's theme.  That's Monday Night Football!

Excellent price point for a tablet for the general population. Hope it works as advertised.
Will definitely enable regular folks to come online and expand their knowledge.

Kudos and Good luck.
Concur with Deepak!

Completely second what the previous two comments have said! Anybody who read the original blog entry (like I did) were completely clear what Anna meant! As for wilful others who wanted to quote (misquote) NYT, good for them!

You keep up the good work and worry not about these guys!

In response to the above comment: "but it takes a huge stretch of one's imagination to interpret "I will change them" as "I will replace them". If you think about it in the 'Indian English' vernacular sense, it actually doesn't. This seems to be a case of semantic misunderstanding.

I fail to understand why Lydia Polgreen used the typical ploy of the Indian press in the Q&A - i.e., manufacturing a controversy over a media generated speculation. The value of arriving at conensus without debate is over-rated - and an unimaginative Indian media prefers nitpicking and controversy mongering over any substantive Q&A. I had reacted to the Q&A earlier as being an opportunity wasted. I wish NYT will not Indianize itseff to the point of wallowing in "media generated news" - but rather serve to enagage those they interview with more depth.
KP.
For India this simple looking step will result into  a vast change in the attitude and well-beings of masses.

Alcoins,

Why shouldn't my child be able to upgrade from n iPhone 3 to and iPhone 4? It's MY MONEY.

Suggest you move to a communist country.

During WWI - top tax rate reached 77%
During WWII - top tax rate reached 94%
Korean War - top tax rate reached 86.45%
Vietnam War - top tax rate reached 91%
We've been at war for 10 years - what's the logical solution?
